channel.title: Proper archives for linux?
channel.description:
using unzip method
lewk@V0912134PQ84Y-1:~$ unzip durr.rar Archive: durr.rar End-of-central-directory signature not found. Either this file is not a zipfile, or it constitutes one disk of a multi-part archive. In the latter case the central directory and zipfile comment will be found on the last disk(s) of this archive. unzip: cannot find zipfile directory in one of durr.rar or durr.rar.zip, and cannot find durr.rar.ZIP, period.
That's one of a few errors, I've tried zip, .tar and .rar (as you can see)
What is the proper archive to use when using the unzip method? .tar? .gzip? I've tried .tar, but i've been archiving it with 7z, i don't know if that's relevant.
But can someone help me out?

item.title: Proper archives for linux?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

user@DEBIAN-VM:~/Desktop$ unrar

UNRAR 3.90 beta 2 freeware      Copyright (c) 1993-2009 Alexander Roshal

Usage:     unrar <command> -<switch 1> -<switch N> <archive> <files...>
               <@listfiles...> <path_to_extract\>

edit: didn’t read above comments; but yeah.

Read full topic

item.title: Proper archives for linux?
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

then i guess this part was just bullshit:

`Lewk_:

I’ve tried zip

Read full topic

item.title: Proper archives for linux?
item.dc:creator: @P_I_M_P_3_D_Tut `Lewk_
item.description:
@P_I_M_P_3_D_Tut wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:2, topic:332897”]what the fuck did you even just say

unzip is for extracting zips, not rars, 7zs, tars or anything other than zips

you can use tar xvf blah.tar to extract a tar, tar zxvf if its a tar.gz and your distros repositories probably contain unrar (apt-get install unrar or yum install unrar or pacman -S unrar or whatever package management system your distro uses)[/quote]
Thank you, that worked.

Read full topic

item.title: Proper archives for linux?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

what the fuck did you even just say

unzip is for extracting zips, not rars, 7zs, tars or anything other than zips

you can use tar xvf blah.tar to extract a tar, tar zxvf if its a tar.gz and your distros repositories probably contain unrar (apt-get install unrar or yum install unrar or pacman -S unrar or whatever package management system your distro uses)

Read full topic

item.title: Proper archives for linux?
item.dc:creator: @P_I_M_P_3_D_Tut `Lewk_
item.description:
@P_I_M_P_3_D_Tut wrote:

using unzip method

lewk@V0912134PQ84Y-1:~$ unzip durr.rar
Archive: durr.rar
End-of-central-directory signature not found. Either this file is not
a zipfile, or it constitutes one disk of a multi-part archive. In the
latter case the central directory and zipfile comment will be found on
the last disk(s) of this archive.
unzip: cannot find zipfile directory in one of durr.rar or
durr.rar.zip, and cannot find durr.rar.ZIP, period.

That’s one of a few errors, I’ve tried zip, .tar and .rar (as you can see)

What is the proper archive to use when using the unzip method? .tar? .gzip?
I’ve tried .tar, but i’ve been archiving it with 7z, i don’t know if that’s relevant.

But can someone help me out?

Read full topic
